english: to pass; to cross; to exceed; overly/too

etymology.interpretation: Movement is signaled by the walking radical 辶/辵, fitting senses like passing, crossing, or going beyond. The phonetic 咼 supplies the sound value guo-, a phonetic shared with characters such as 渦 and 蝸.
etymology.simplification: Traditional 過 was simplified to 过 by reducing 辵 to 辶 and collapsing the complex phonetic 咼 to a simpler right-side form (often analyzed as 寸), reflecting cursive/abbreviated handwriting; the original phonetic transparency was largely sacrificed for fewer strokes.

parts.english: crooked; askew (also used as a phonetic component)

examples.chinese: 我们走过这座桥(我們走過這座橋)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zǒu guò zhè zuò qiáo.

examples.chinese: 我去过中国(我去過中國)。
examples.english: I have been to China before.

examples.chinese: 别吃过多的糖(別吃過多的糖)。
